oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Pulsebeat Radio Show: Mary Chapin Carpenter - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recording is of Kim Spangler (host) dictating the Pulsebeat section of the Voice of the Heartland Radio Show. The episode interviews Mary Chapin Carpenter (musician). The episode was set to air for the week of June 26, 1988. The episode is part 1 of 2.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Kim Spangler; Mary Chapin Carpenter
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:01) Kim Spangler introduces the upcoming Mary Chapin Carpenter Pulsebeat show -- (00:41) How Do (Mary Chapin Carpenter) -- (02:40) Spangler introduces the commercial break -- (02:54) Spangler asks Mary Chapin Carpenter what the difference is of 'State of the Heart' from other albums -- (03:38) Read My Lips (Mary Chapin Carpenter) -- (06:17) Spangler asks why Carpenter chooses to record in Washington D. C. -- (06:56) Slow Country Dance (Mary Chapin Carpenter) -- (10:37) Spangler introduces the commercial break -- (10:43) An unidentified host performs an Easy Quit commercial spot -- (11:40) Danny Thomas performs a St. Jude's commercial spot -- (12:10) Spangler asks Carpenter which song she wishes to here -- (12:29) She's No Lady (Lyle Lovett) -- (15:37) Spangler asks what was the motivating factor of her career -- (16:27) An unidentified host performs an Easy Quit commercial spot -- (17:37) Carpenter says "This Shirt" wrote itself -- (18:30) This Shirt (Mary Chapin Carpenter) -- (21:52) "Something of a Dreamer" is called an autobiographical tune by Carpenter -- (22:39) Something of a Dreamer [Live] (Mary Chapin Carpenter) -- (25:37) Unidentified tune [featuring Kim Spangler outro discussion] ([Unidentified])
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Spangler, Kim; Carpenter, Mary Chapin, 1958-;
